isis.stitle: Recall 98507 - Vehicle Recall for All Models with T 444E Engine

recall.subject: Vehicle Recall for All Models with T 444E Engine

defect.para: This Recall applies to all models built from 12/23/97 through 8/14/98 with a T 444E diesel engine. Engine serial numbers starting with 661894 to 802224.

The high pressure oil line for the fuel injection system that goes from the high pressure pump to the right cylinder head (as viewed from rear of engine) may fail due to rubbing on the charge air cooler (CAC) crossover pipe. This contact can eventually wear through the protective loom over the hose causing the hose to fail resulting in a sudden loss of oil. If the vehicle is being operated at the time, the engine could stall without warning with no ability to re-start which could cause a vehicular accident and result in person injury, property damage, or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses will have been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

note.para: Be sure to observe the routing of the high pressure hose before it is removed. When replacing the high pressure oil hose, it should be routed exactly like the original application. Improper routing of the high pressure oil hose can cause damage during the operation.

step1.para: Disconnect the right bank high pressure oil hose from the right cylinder head and the high pressure oil pump by inserting the fork of the quick disconnect tool (ZTSE4449) between the rubber umbrella and steel flange on the hose. After tool ZTSE4449 is inserted, a light tug on the hose is necessary to remove it from the fittings.

note.para: Prying or leverage with the tool is not necessary and will only result in tool damage.

step1.para: Remove the original hose from the engine valley.
Remove the convoluted conduit from the high pressure oil hose.
If the aluminum part number tag is not at one end, slide it to the end of the hose with the 90 degree elbow.
Inspect the hose for abrasion at the point at which it crosses under the CAC crossover tube.
If any abrasion is detected, replace the hose with a new hose assembly 1831422C91. and then skip to Item 9. (New assembly has both convoluted conduits installed.)
If no abrasion is observed, re-install the removed convoluted conduit over the hose.
Using the newly supplied larger convoluted conduit 1831822C1, which should remain uncut, slide it over the already existing conduit.

step2.para: The hose runs from the high pressure oil pump under the wire harness and under the CAC crossover tube.
Route the hose above the fuel lines directly under the CAC crossover tube to the right cylinder head.
Once the hose has been installed, verify the connections with a slight tug on the hose.

note.para: The engine may smoke and run poorly for several minutes upon start-up until the air is purged from the system.

entry.para: Hose, Oil, High Pressure with Both Conduits
Remove hose and re-use if okay or replace if damaged

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location. Dearlers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44:

responex.para: We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact the Regional Service Manager at your regional office.
